rules: CRITICAL: All internal imports MUST use the '.js' extension for ESM compatibility (as per CONTRIBUTING.md).
CRITICAL: Node.js built-in modules MUST use the 'node:' prefix (e.g., 'import { readFile } from "node:fs/promises"').
CRITICAL: AI providers MUST follow the Singleton/Strategy patterns to reuse connections and maintain modularity (see docs/ARCHITECTURE.md).
CRITICAL: All public functions and methods MUST have explicit return types. No implicit 'any'.
PERFORMANCE: Independent tasks (file reads, API requests) MUST use 'Promise.all' for parallel execution to ensure network efficiency.
PERFORMANCE: Network calls (fetch/API) MUST be preceded by validation checks to 'Fail Fast' and avoid redundant traffic (see docs/NETWORK_EFFICIENCY.md).
PERFORMANCE: Batch processing MUST implement configurable concurrency control (default: 5) to respect API rate limits.
CLEAN CODE: Use 'camelCase' for functions, 'SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE' for constants, and 'PascalCase' for types/interfaces.
CLEAN CODE: Interfaces implemented as a Strategy (like AI providers) should use the 'I' prefix (e.g., 'IAIProvider').
CLEAN CODE: Error handling MUST use type guards (e.g., 'error instanceof Error') instead of casting to 'any'.
STYLE: Constants (like MAX_FILE_SIZE or prompts) MUST be extracted from logic blocks into named constants.
ARCHITECTURE: Public API exports MUST be kept in 'src/lib.ts' and separate from the CLI runner in 'src/index.ts'.

commitPatterns.description: Performance improvements (very important for this project)
